etymologies: late Middle English (denoting the arc of a celestial circle from the zenith to the horizon): from Old French azimut, from Arabic as-samt, from al ‘the’ + samt ‘way, direction’

definitions: the direction of a celestial object from the observer, expressed as the angular distance from the north or south point of the horizon to the point at which a vertical circle passing through the object intersects the horizon.
shortDefinitions: direction of celestial object from observer

definitions: the horizontal angle or direction of a compass bearing.
shortDefinitions: horizontal angle or direction of compass bearing
